channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024070109
item.description:
Report X-2024070109

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PKG WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEKAGE. UPON INSPECTION TWO BOTTLES OF ZEP INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER WAS FOUND TO BE 1/2 WAY LEAKED OUT CAUSE FROM THE CAPS BEING LOOSE. THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO AREA; HAZMAT FOUND ON FLOOR WITHOUT ANY STAINS OF BEING WET. UPON FURTHUR INVESTIGATION AND FOLLOWING PROTOCAL, RESPONDER FOUND THAT THE BOX LEAKED. RESPONDER CONTANERIZED BOX AND TOOK TO HAZMAT DMP AREA FOR FURTHUR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024070259
item.description:
Report X-2024070259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of release at the EWRH facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained twenty glass bottles packaged inside of plastic sealed bags with egg crates top and bottom. One of the bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024060669
item.description:
Report E-2024060669

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: CLIFTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-3ft area of the trailer wall and estimated that forty (40) cardboard packages containing 1-gallon each was damaged from a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of material. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a cleaner to the impacted area and used absorbent rags to recover the spent material. The impacted rags were containerized along with impacted cardboard into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the consignee’s location. A second response the next day at the terminal resulted in one (1) ounce of material leaking from the repalletized packages. The contractor deployed a cleaner again to the impacted area of the trailer floor and used absorbent rags to recover the spent material. Clean Harbors generated two (2) additional 55-gallon poly drums. The two (2) drums of waste were staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
